segment.source: How to Enable Reporting on the App-V 5.0 Client by Using PowerShell
segment.target: How to Enable Reporting on the App-V 5.0 Client by Using PowerShell

segment.source: How to Enable Reporting on the App-V 5.0 Client by Using PowerShell
segment.target: How to Enable Reporting on the App-V 5.0 Client by Using PowerShell

segment.source: How to Enable Reporting on the App-V 5.0 Client by Using PowerShell
segment.target: How to Enable Reporting on the App-V 5.0 Client by Using PowerShell

segment.source: Use the following procedure to configure the App-V 5.0 for reporting.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to configure the App-V 5.0 for reporting.

segment.source: To configure the computer running the App-V 5.0 client for reporting
segment.target: To configure the computer running the App-V 5.0 client for reporting

segment.source: Install the App-V 5.0 client.
segment.target: Install the App-V 5.0 client.

segment.source: For more information about installing the client see How to Deploy the App-V Client.
segment.target: For more information about installing the client see How to Deploy the App-V Client.

segment.source: After you have installed the App-V 5.0 client, use the Set-AppvClientConfiguration PowerShell to configure appropriate Reporting Configuration settings:
segment.target: After you have installed the App-V 5.0 client, use the Set-AppvClientConfiguration PowerShell to configure appropriate Reporting Configuration settings:

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: ReportingEnabled
segment.target: ReportingEnabled

segment.source: Enables the client to return information to a reporting server.
segment.target: Enables the client to return information to a reporting server.

segment.source: This setting is required for the client to collect the reporting data on the client.
segment.target: This setting is required for the client to collect the reporting data on the client.

segment.source: ReportingServerURL
segment.target: ReportingServerURL

segment.source: Specifies the location on the reporting server where client information is saved.
segment.target: Specifies the location on the reporting server where client information is saved.

segment.source: For example, http://reportingservername:reportingportnumber.
segment.target: For example, http://reportingservername:reportingportnumber.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: This is the port number that was assigned during the Reporting Server setup
segment.target: This is the port number that was assigned during the Reporting Server setup

segment.source: Reporting Start Time
segment.target: Reporting Start Time

segment.source: This is set to schedule the client to automatically send the data to the server.
segment.target: This is set to schedule the client to automatically send the data to the server.

segment.source: This setting will indicate the hour at which the reporting data will start to send.
segment.target: This setting will indicate the hour at which the reporting data will start to send.

segment.source: It is in the 24 hour format and will take a number between 0-23.
segment.target: It is in the 24 hour format and will take a number between 0-23.

segment.source: ReportingRandomDelay
segment.target: ReportingRandomDelay

segment.source: Specifies the maximum delay (in minutes) for data to be sent to the reporting server.
segment.target: Specifies the maximum delay (in minutes) for data to be sent to the reporting server.

segment.source: When the scheduled task is started, the client generates a random delay between 0 and ReportingRandomDelay and will wait the specified duration before sending data.
segment.target: When the scheduled task is started, the client generates a random delay between 0 and ReportingRandomDelay and will wait the specified duration before sending data.

segment.source: ReportingInterval
segment.target: ReportingInterval

segment.source: Specifies the retry interval that the client will use to resend data to the reporting server.
segment.target: Specifies the retry interval that the client will use to resend data to the reporting server.

segment.source: ReportingDataCacheLimit
segment.target: ReportingDataCacheLimit

segment.source: Specifies the maximum size in megabytes (MB) of the XML cache for storing reporting information.
segment.target: Specifies the maximum size in megabytes (MB) of the XML cache for storing reporting information.

segment.source: The size applies to the cache in memory.
segment.target: The size applies to the cache in memory.

segment.source: When the limit is reached, the log file will roll over.
segment.target: When the limit is reached, the log file will roll over.

segment.source: ReportingDataBlockSize
segment.target: ReportingDataBlockSize

segment.source: Specifies the maximum size in megabytes (MB) of the XML cache for storing reporting information.
segment.target: Specifies the maximum size in megabytes (MB) of the XML cache for storing reporting information.

segment.source: The size applies to the cache in memory.
segment.target: The size applies to the cache in memory.

segment.source: When the limit is reached, the log file will roll over.
segment.target: When the limit is reached, the log file will roll over.

segment.source: After the appropriate settings have been configured, the computer running the App-V 5.0 client will automatically collect data and will send the data back to the reporting server.
segment.target: After the appropriate settings have been configured, the computer running the App-V 5.0 client will automatically collect data and will send the data back to the reporting server.

segment.source: Additionally, administrators can manually send the data back in an on-demand manner using the Send-AppvClientReport PowerShell cmdlet.
segment.target: Additionally, administrators can manually send the data back in an on-demand manner using the Send-AppvClientReport PowerShell cmdlet.

segment.source: Got a suggestion for App-V?
segment.target: Got a suggestion for App-V?

segment.target: Use the App-V TechNet Forum.
